Help:Node.title: General Concepts: Gesture
Help:Node.Log:Description:
Title: Gesture
Important Commands: applaud, bow, frown, gulp, laugh, point, salute, slap, smile, smirk, wave
Syntax: "wave", "applaud loudly", "salute", "bow regally"
Skotos Theatres and games include an extensive dictionary of gestures which allow you to express emotion without speech. Over 1500 verbs and 1800 adverbs are available.
With gestures you can interact with the environment and other characters. You can $(udat.chatchar)FROWN, $(udat.chatchar)SMILE, $(udat.chatchar)LAUGH, and $(udat.chatchar)SMIRK. You can $(udat.chatchar)POINT at items or characters. Adverbs may be used with verbs to enhance and better explain the meaning of a gesture. To convey an action with an unconventional twist one might "$(udat.chatchar)bow sloppily" or perhaps "$(udat.chatchar)smirk playfully" to convey action above and beyond the norm. This adds personal flavor to the action and demonstrates a specific emotion for a gesture.
See Also: Adverbs, Communicate, Emotion
